meanings.definition: A type of porridge made from buckwheat or other grains.
meanings.sent1: For breakfast, she enjoyed a warm bowl of kashas.
meanings.sent2: The kashas at the restaurant were flavorful and filling.
meanings.sent3: When the kashas spilled, it looked like a grainy avalanche.
meanings.sent4: Her love for kashas was as deep as the bowl she ate from.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of kashas cooking filled the kitchen with comfort.

meanings.definition: Plural form of kasha, referring to multiple servings of the dish.
meanings.sent1: The family shared a large pot of kashas during the gathering.
meanings.sent2: At the party, guests enjoyed seconds of the delicious kashas.
meanings.sent3: The table was full of laughter and empty plates of kashas.
meanings.sent4: The kashas disappeared from the table as quickly as they appeared.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of kashas filled the room, tempting everyone to have more.

meanings.definition: A surname of Eastern European origin.
meanings.sent1: Mr. and Mrs. Kashas were well-known in the community.
meanings.sent2: The Kashas family had a long history in the town.
meanings.sent3: When someone mispronounced 'Kashas', the family would chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The Kashas name carried a sense of pride and tradition.
meanings.sent5: In the Kashas household, family values were cherished above all else.
